Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Pestle
Description: This big oval-shaped quartz piece of stone was used as a pestle to crush products, such as red ochre, as demonstrated by the percussion marks and traces of a red colour at one of the extremities. The other end has been used as well, but wear marks are not as numerous and there are no traces of red.
